item.title: 尽管排他性窗口已结束，但与 Tanure 基金的 Braskem 出售谈判仍在继续
item.description: 巴西公司 Novonor（前身为 Odebrecht）在周五提交的一份证券文件中称，尽管 90 天的排他性谈判期限已经结束，但有关巴西公司 Novonor 向商人 Nelson Tanure 支持的一家基金出售石化公司 Braskem 控股权的谈判仍在继续。【原文：Talks for Brazilian firm Novonor, formerly Odebrecht, to sell a controlling stake in petrochemical company Braskem to a fund backed by businessman Nelson Tanure continue, despite the end of a 90-day exclusive negotiation deadline, Braskem said in a securities filing on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道加航劳资协议因工资问题面临激烈反对，投票可能失败
item.description: 许多加拿大航空公司的空乘人员对本周早些时候结束瘫痪性罢工的临时协议中的工资涨幅表示不满，该协议可能无法赢得工会成员、机舱乘务员的批准，一位熟悉此事的消息人士告诉路透社记者。【原文：Many Air Canada flight attendants are dissatisfied with wage increases in a tentative agreement that ended a crippling strike earlier this week and the deal may not win approval from union members, cabin crew and a source familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 贝莱德的 Levy-Odom 将领导美洲地区的监管工作
item.description: 全球最大的资产管理公司贝莱德（BlackRock）最近晋升了其管理团队的一名高级成员，负责领导公司与美洲地区数千家企业的互动，这也是一系列更广泛的管理层变动的一部分。【原文：BlackRock , the world's biggest asset manager, recently promoted a senior member of its stewardship team to lead the company's interactions with thousands of corporations in the Americas as part of a broader series of management changes.】

item.title: 惠誉确认美国评级为 "AA+
item.description: 信用评级机构惠誉周五确认美国的长期外币发行人违约评级为 "AA+"，前景稳定。【原文：Credit ratings agency Fitch on Friday affirmed the United States' long-term foreign currency issuer default rating at 'AA+' with a stable outlook.】

item.title: 工会官员表示，波音防务公司与罢工的机械师工会将于周一恢复谈判
item.description: 据一位工会官员称，波音公司和机械师工会官员定于周一恢复合同谈判。【原文：Boeing and Machinists union officials are slated to resume contract negotiations on Monday, according to a union official.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，特朗普准备在周五公布英特尔股权交易方案
item.description: 彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）援引熟悉该计划的人士的话报道称，特朗普政府和英特尔准备在周五宣布一项协议的细节，即美国政府将获得这家陷入困境的芯片制造商的股权。【原文：The Trump administration and Intel are poised to announce details of an agreement to give the U.S. government an equity stake in the troubled chipmaker on Friday, Bloomberg News reported, citing people familiar with the plan.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，苹果公司正在洽谈使用谷歌的双子座人工智能技术为改版 Siri 提供支持
item.description: 彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道称，苹果公司正在就使用谷歌 Gemini 人工智能改造 Siri 语音助手进行早期谈判。【原文：Apple is in early talks to use Google's Gemini AI to revamp the Siri voice assistant, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 据 CBO 估计，特朗普的关税措施可使美国赤字减少 4 万亿美元
item.description: 据美国国会预算办公室周五估计，唐纳德-特朗普总统对美国从外国进口商品加征关税的措施可在未来十年内使国家赤字减少 4 万亿美元。【原文：President Donald Trump's increased tariffs on U.S. imports from foreign countries could reduce the national deficit by $4 trillion over the next decade, the Congressional Budget Office estimated on Friday.】

item.title: 网络安全公司 Netskope 申请在美国上市
item.description: 网络安全公司 Netskope 周五在美国提交了首次公开募股申请。【原文：Cybersecurity firm Netskope filed for an initial public offering in the U.S. on Friday.】

item.title: Waymo 首次获得在纽约市测试自动驾驶汽车的许可
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的机器人出租车公司 Waymo 获得了在纽约市开始测试自动驾驶汽车的首张许可证，测试时由一名训练有素的专家驾驶，这有助于该公司推进其自动驾驶雄心。【原文：Alphabet's robotaxi unit Waymo has received its first permit to begin testing its autonomous vehicles in New York City with a trained specialist behind the wheel, helping the company advance its self-driving ambitions.】

item.title: BNSF 和 CSX 启动新的美国海岸至海岸连接，以促进货运服务
item.description: CSX 和伯克希尔-哈撒韦（Berkshire Hathaway）旗下的 BNSF 周五宣布推出新的海岸至海岸服务，以促进美国的货运连接。【原文：CSX and Berkshire Hathaway-owned BNSF on Friday announced new coast-to-coast services to boost freight connectivity in the United States.】

item.title: 巴西出口商集团称美国关税是全球阿拉比卡价格飙升的幕后推手
item.description: 巴西咖啡出口商理事会（Cecafe）负责人周五表示，8月份全球阿拉比卡咖啡市场大幅上涨，ICE交易所的价格涨幅超过30%，主要原因是美国大幅提高了关税。【原文：The global arabica coffee market has surged in August with prices gaining more than 30% on the ICE exchange, driven mainly by steep tariff hikes from the United States, the head of Brazil's coffee exporters council, Cecafe, said on Friday.】

item.title: 鲍威尔在杰克逊霍尔发表讲话，鸽派倾向令市场火热
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周五发表了备受关注的杰克逊霍尔（Jackson Hole）演讲，令市场对美国央行准备放宽利率的乐观情绪升温，投资者纷纷涌入风险较高的资产和对利率敏感的行业。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's closely watched Jackson Hole speech on Friday boosted optimism in markets that the U.S. central bank is poised to ease rates, sending investors to pile into riskier assets and interest-rate-sensitive sectors.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，随着数据争夺战白热化，维萨关闭了美国开放银行部门
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周五援引知情人士的话报道，支付处理商 Visa 已关闭其在美国的开放银行业务。【原文：Payments processor Visa has shut its open-banking business in the United States, Bloomberg News reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 法国葡萄酒制造商担心特朗普关税将打击其在至关重要的美国市场的销量
item.description: 法国葡萄酒和烈酒生产商正准备对其出口到美国这一重要市场的产品征收 15%的关税，尽管欧盟委员会承诺将继续为该行业争取优惠税率。【原文：French wine and spirits producers are bracing for a 15% tariff on their exports to the United States, a crucial market, even as the European Commission pledges to keep pressing for a preferential rate for the sector.】

item.title: 智利国家石油公司下调产量预期，税前利润下降
item.description: 世界最大的铜生产商智利科德尔科公司 [RIC:RIC:COBRE.UL] 周五公布，2025 年上半年税前利润为 4.29 亿美元，比去年同期的 6.53 亿美元下降了 34%。【原文：Chile's Codelco [RIC:RIC:COBRE.UL], the world's largest copper producer, on Friday posted a pre-tax profit of $429 million for the first half of 2025, down 34% from the $653 million reported in the same period last year.】

item.title: 美国环保局开始清理积压的炼油厂生物燃料规则豁免申请
item.description: 美国环境保护局周五开始清理积压的小型炼油厂提出的国家生物燃料法豁免申请，批准了其中的 63 项，拒绝了 28 项，77 项获得部分批准。【原文：The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency on Friday began clearing a backlog of requests from small oil refineries for exemptions from the nation's biofuel laws, granting 63 and denying 28 of the them, with 77 receiving partial approvals.】

item.title: 瑞士 Safra Sarasin 银行在 "洗车 "调查中被罚款 350 万瑞士法郎
item.description: 瑞士总检察长周五表示，在围绕巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）的一起长达数年的腐败和洗钱案中，瑞士私人银行 J. Safra Sarasin SA 被处以 350 万瑞士法郎（430 万美元）的罚款。【原文：Switzerland's attorney general has fined Swiss private bank J. Safra Sarasin SA 3.5 million Swiss francs ($4.3 million) under a years-long corruption and money laundering case surrounding Brazilian state oil company Petrobras, it said on Friday.】

item.title: 消息人士称加拿大将取消多项针对美国商品的报复性关税
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士称，加拿大将于周五宣布取消对美国商品征收的多项报复性关税，以此作为重启停滞不前的贸易谈判的善意姿态。【原文：Canada will announce on Friday that it is removing many retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods as a goodwill gesture designed to restart stalled trade talks, a source familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 穆迪将精神航空的信用评级进一步降至垃圾级
item.description: 周五，穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）将美国航空运营商精神航空公司（Spirit Airlines）的信用评级下调两级，使其再次跌入垃圾级。【原文：U.S. airline operator Spirit Airlines took another hit to its credit rating on Friday after Moody's Ratings downgraded it two notches deeper into junk territory.】

item.title: 消息人士称，亚马逊游说印度政府免除出口产品的外商投资限制
item.description: 四位直接了解此事的人士称，亚马逊正在游说印度政府放宽外商投资规定，允许这家美国公司直接从印度卖家那里购买产品在海外市场销售。【原文：Amazon is lobbying the Indian government to ease its foreign investment rules to allow the U.S. company to buy products directly from Indian sellers to sell in overseas markets, four people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 花旗提升埃里克-萨沃拉（Erik Savola）为欧洲企业银行业务负责人
item.description: 根据路透社周五看到的一份备忘录，花旗集团提升埃里克-萨沃拉（Erik Savola）为欧洲企业银行业务主管，立即生效。【原文：Citigroup promoted Erik Savola to become its head of corporate banking for Europe, effective immediately, according to a memo seen by Reuters on Friday.】

item.title: 特朗普称必要时可延长 TikTok 的最后期限，美国有买家
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周五表示，他已为 TikTok 物色到了美国买家，他可能会进一步延长总部位于中国的字节跳动剥离该应用美国资产的最后期限，并补充说他并不担心隐私或安全问题。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said he has American buyers lined up for TikTok and that he could further extend the deadline for China-based ByteDance to divest the app's U.S. assets, adding that he did not have privacy or security concerns.】

item.title: 特朗普称若美联储主席库克不辞职将解雇她
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周五表示，如果美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）不辞职，他将解雇她，这加大了他对美国中央银行施加影响的力度。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday said he would fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook if she doesn't resign, intensifying his effort to gain influence over the U.S. central bank.】

item.title: VIEW 美联储鲍威尔为 9 月宽松政策敞开大门
item.description: 美国联邦储备委员会主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周五在讲话中指出，该央行可能在9月份的会议上降息，但并未做出承诺，他在讲话中谨慎地承认了就业市场面临的日益增长的风险，同时还表示通胀上升的风险依然存在。【原文：U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Friday pointed to a possible rate cut at the central bank's September meeting but stopped short of committing to it in remarks that walked a narrow line acknowledging growing risks to the job market while also saying risks of higher inflation remain.】

item.title: 中国碧桂园预计上半年亏损将因减值增加而扩大
item.description: 陷入困境的中国房地产开发商碧桂园周五预计，2025 财年上半年将出现更大亏损，原因是资产减值增加和房地产项目结算规模缩小。【原文：Embattled Chinese property developer Country Garden on Friday forecast a bigger loss for the first half of fiscal 2025, citing higher asset impairments and reduced scale of real estate project settlements.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔宣布调整政策框架以应对经济形势变化
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周五宣布了美国中央银行的最新运营框架，反映了过去五年来经济格局的重大变化，该框架反映了通胀压力的回升和短期利率接近零的前景的减弱。【原文：Nodding toward significant changes in the economic landscape over the last five years, Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell on Friday announced an updated operating framework for the U.S. central bank that reflects the return of higher inflation pressures and reduced prospect of near zero short-term interest rates.】

item.title: 全球股票基金流入降温，因对科技行业大跌持谨慎态度
item.description: 截至8月20日的一周内，全球股票基金流入量大幅下降，原因是市场对领先科技股的下挫持谨慎态度，而美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔即将于本周末在杰克逊霍尔年度研讨会上发表的讲话也加剧了市场的避险情绪。【原文：Global equity fund inflows dropped sharply in the week through August 20 on caution over a selloff in leading technology stocks, with the Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's upcoming speech at the annual Jackson Hole symposium this weekend, also adding to risk aversion.】

item.title: 挪威巨型基金因以色列投资问题陷入选举漩涡
item.description: 在以色列的投资已成为挪威竞选活动的中心议题，引发了一场关于世界上最大的主权财富基金如何运作的不同寻常的公开辩论。【原文：Investments in Israel have taken centre stage in Norway's election campaign, sparking an unusually public debate over how the world's largest sovereign wealth fund operates.】

item.title: 欧盟对俄罗斯进口化肥征收关税后，欧洲农民面临更高的成本
item.description: 欧盟对俄罗斯进口化肥征收关税的目的是削减莫斯科在乌克兰战争中的资金投入，但迄今为止，这些关税打击了欧洲农民，提高了成本，并可能导致消费者价格上涨，而俄罗斯公司则表示，他们可以将出口转向其他市场。【原文：EU tariffs on Russian fertiliser imports that aim to cut funding for Moscow's war in Ukraine have so far hit European farmers, raising costs and risking higher consumer prices while Russian companies say they can divert exports to other markets.】
